data.text:
Every invocation to our APIs must send the following header:
 
          "serviceConsumerData":
            {
            "auditCorrelationId": "17f24136-2494-4bf8-9d3b-9baafaae0cc9",
            "serviceRequestTimestamp": "2017-08-29T12:58:31.470Z",
            "sourceSystem": "DRDP",
            "endUserId": "H574857",
            "authenticationId": "EsbDRDPAccount",
            "tenantId": "DRDP",
            "locale": "English"
          }
 
This is part of our best practices in the ESB for auditing.
 
The fields description is as follows
 
1.       auditCorrelationId  unique id for the invocation (GUID if you will)
2.       serviceRequestTimestamp  UTF for the time the API is invoked.
3.       sourceSystem  should always be DRDP
4.       endUserId  needs to be provided. For now please use X0DRDP
5.       authenticationId  needs to be provided. For now please use X0DRDP
6.       tenantId  should always be DRDP
7.       locale  should always be English
 
The curl scripts also contain an example.

data.text:
Made the following changes for enforcement of current application color scheme task: 

1. Adjust data-table to reflect other elements in data export page
	a. remove css border (report-shell)
	b. Add 2px #fff; border-right, border-left to THEAD (report-values-header)
2. Change margin-left: from 5px to 10px on #exportReportButton .hdd-icon
3. Change margin-left: from 5px to 10px on rp-wrapper . rp-container . rp-action-buttons button .hdd-icon
4. Remove border-radius:4px from background of creation date (reports .report-summary table tr td#creationDate span:last-child)
5. Changerequired asterick to default font size( rp-group span) font-size from 13px to 17px (create css style .rp-required)
6. Clear button in report parameters should say "Clear report button"
7. Appended "button" on all buttons
8. Correct "save button" ("Save button") and "delete button" ("Delete button") on save button in saved disasters list
9. Change title "Search Disasters Magnifying Glass Icon" on disaster search to "Search disaster magnifying icon"

data.text:
For example... the user clicks a link "Help! How do I use this tool?" Then there's a modal dialogue that pops up by the search component "Start here by typing in a FEMA disaster ID in the format "DR-4272-TX"." Then they follow the instructions (or click "next"?) and when search results come up, a new modal dialogue says "Click the box to select a disaster". Then when they do that, the disaster moves to the saved search component and a new dialogue pops up saying "You've selected a disaster and it is now listed here. You can either export the associated FEMA data, or save this search to export the data in the future." (highlight save and export buttons). 

The end?

At all times, have a button off to the side that says "Close help dialogue."
